definition: Min dialects, spoken in Fujian Province, Taiwan etc
short name for Fujian province 福建[Fu2 jian4]/also pr. [Min2]

sentences.english: Those South-Fujian-Dialect-speaking population were mostly Han migrants from northern China.
sentences.chinese: 闽语人群基本都是来源于北方的汉族移民。

sentences.english: The Teochew people, the people in Hailufeng and the people in Leizhou Peninsula all speak a language similar to Min.
sentences.chinese: 在海陆丰和雷州半岛地区，人们讲的语言类似于闽语。

definition: Southern Min, a Sinitic language spoken in southern Fujian and surrounding areas
Southern Min, a Sinitic language spoken in southern Fujian and surrounding areas
Huizhou dialect of Gan, spoken in southern parts of Anhui Province
Gan dialect, spoken in Jiangxi Province
Wu dialects (spoken primarily in Shanghai and surrounding areas)
the first Chinese dialect dictionary, edited by Yang Xiong 揚雄|扬雄[Yang2 Xiong2] in 1st century, containing over 9000 characters
Xiang (Hunanese) dialect spoken in Hunan Province
